alert.note: Alert for Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Williamsburg County through 800 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Salters, or 11 miles east of Manning, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kingstree, Salters, Gourdin, Lane, Greeleyville and Williamsburg Regional Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
